subject: Cybersecurity
title: Post-Quantum Cryptography: Preparing for Q-Day
description: A quick, practical guide to Post-Quantum Cryptography: Preparing for Q-Day.

hook.text: NIST spent 6 years choosing new encryption standards that quantum computers can't break. The winners are here.

buildup.text: Post-quantum cryptography uses math problems that are hard for both classical and quantum computers.

discovery.text: CRYSTALS-Kyber (key exchange) and CRYSTALS-Dilithium (signatures) are the new standards, based on lattice math.

twist.text: We need to migrate trillions of systems before quantum computers mature. The transition may take a decade.

punchline.text: The encryption of the future is being installed today.
